champ.champInfo:
The general management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the youth and sports department of the Berdychiv city council. The Berdychiv City Federation of Kyokushinkai Karate is directly responsible for conducting the competition. The chief judge of the competition (chairman of the organizing committee) is Ryabushkin Anatoliy Valeriyovych (Berdychiv); Deputy head judge – Ruslan Serhiyovych Stukal (Zhytomyr) Secretary of the competition – Andriy Mykolayovych Yatsyuk (Berdychiv)

The competition is held in the city of Berdychiv, 05/07/2023. Venue – Children's and Youth Sports School named after V.O. Lonskogo, str. European, 35/1 The start of the competition is May 7, 2023 at 9:00 a.m

Competition organizing committee:

Preliminary applications for participation in the competition must be sent by April 30, 2023 (inclusive) to the address: e-mail: (hidden) phone numbers for previous applications: Ihor Tatarchenko - 0677887728; Ruslan Stukal - 0972226845;

Program

  • 07:00-08:00 arrival of teams, registration
  • 08:00-08:30 approval of competition protocols
  • 08:30-09:00 meeting of competition judges
  • 09:00-09:30 ceremonial opening of the competition
  • 09:30-13:00 qualifying matches
  • 13:00-13:30 lunch
  • 13:30-17:00 semi-final and final matches
  • 17:00-18:00 awarding of winners and prize-winners of the competition, closing of the competition
  • 18:00-18:30 departure of the teams

Competition participants

Competitions are held separately for male and female participants. Qualification degree:- Series A (8 kyu and older), Series B (up to 9 kyu) - born in 2009-2016.

Tournament rules

Competitions are held in accordance with the "Kyokushinkai Karate Competition Rules" in force in Ukraine. Team qualifying is common for male and female participants. To determine the places of the teams based on individual and team championship, the results of only those participants included in the qualifying teams will be taken into account. The standings of the teams are finally determined by the mandate committee. Team points are calculated according to the rules of kyokushinkai karate competitions in force in Ukraine

Categories KUMITE men

  • 2015-2016: -20; -25; -30; -35;-40; 40+
  • 2013-2014: -25; -30; -35; -40; 40+
  • 2011-2012: -40; -45; -50; -55; 55+
  • 2009-2010: -45; -50; -55; -60; 60+
  • 2007-2008: -50; -55; -60; -65; -70; -75; +75
  • 2005-2006: -60; -65; -70; -75; -80; +80
  • adults: -60; -65; -75; -85; +85

Categories of KUMITE women

  • 2015-2016: -20; -25; -30; -35;-40; 40+
  • 2013-2014: -25; -30; -35; -40; 40+
  • 2011-2012: -40; -45; -50; -55; 55+
  • 2009-2010: -45; -50; -55; -60; 60+
  • 2007-2008: -45 -50 -55 -60 60+
  • 2005-2006: -50; -55; -60; +60
  • adults: -55; -60; -65; +65

Conducting matches and duration of matches.

  • 2009-2016: 1.0 min.; 1.0 min.; 1.0 min
  • 2007+: 2.0 min.; 2.0 min.; 2.0 min

Holding of matches and duration of matches (men/women).

Rewarding

Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded with cups, diplomas and medals of the respective degrees.
